author: ELDASPOXD666
title: Not the best LEGO set, but surely one of the most fun sets to play with
review:
Today, I decided to write a review about another good set I had as a kid: Kai ZX's spinner!

Backstory:

I've been a Ninjago fan since the show's pilot episode first aired in 2011, with Kai being my favorite character. And I specially liked the ZX suits that were introduced for Season 1, which is why I got this spinner pack specifically. I'm a big fan of the spinner battle gimmick introduced with these packs, but I never got to fully experience it because none of my friends had spinners (though I sometimes placed a bunch of minifigures on the floor and tried to knock them out with my spinner).

Build:

Because this is a spinner pack, this set has a very low piece count (it only has 27 pieces), therefore, it doesn't have any significant builds, with the spinner and a spear being the only things you can actually build (aside from the minifigure). And even though they're not builds, this set also comes with the Sword of Fire, a bo staff, and 5 cards that are used for spinner battles. Even though this set doesn't strive for show accuracy (just like every other spinner pack), it portrays the show's Spinjitzu tornadoes in a somewhat accurate way.

Minifigures:

The minifigure selection is nothing special, as this set only includes Kai ZX, and even though he's one of the most common minifigures from the Rise of the Snakes wave, this set is the cheapest way to get him.

Price:

I think the $10 price for this set is perfect considering the piece count. That's it, there's nothing else to say about the price.

Extra:

For the extra section, I want to talk about the spinner battle gimmick. Personally, I like it, and I think it's one of the most original gimmicks LEGO has ever made (even though it's been used many times throughout the Ninjago sets). The only issue I have with it is the fact that you need a friend with a spinner to actually play spinner battles (and like I said previously, none of my friends had spinners, so I couldn't do that).

Overall opinion:

Overall, I think it's a decent set, and I'd recommend it to people who want to play spinner battles with their friends, or to people who want a cheap way to get Kai ZX with the Sword of Fire. Though, I wouldn't recommend it to people who want Spinjitzu tornadoes that are accurate to the show (if you want that, you should either buy the Legacy spinners, or the Season 11 spinners).
